case.name: Schwabe Pharma (Aust) Pty Ltd v AusPharm.Net.Au Pty Ltd (with Corrigendum dated 12 July 2006) [2006] FCA 868 (5 July 2006)

trade practices
misleading or deceptive conduct
whether publication of statements including statements of opinions made in ordinary course of publication of news (not being advertising material) can constitute misleading or deceptive conduct
publication of material constituting conduct for purposes of sub-s. 52(1) of the trade practices act 1974

disadvantages of stated case procedure. trade practices act 1974 , ss. 4(2) , 80 , 52 (1), 53 (e), 82 , 84 85 (3), 87 federal court of australia act 1976 , sub-s. 25(6) trade practices
misleading or deceptive conduct
publication of statements including statements of opinion in ordinary course of publication of newspaper
whether misleading or deceptive conduct
whether statements convey misrepresentation

trade practices act 1974 (cth), s. 4(2). held: (1) publication of statements, including statements of opinion, made in the ordinary course of the publication of a newspaper can constitute misleading and deceptive conduct within the trade practices act 1974 (cth), s. 52. there is no definable boundary between conduct which is misleading or deceptive or likely to mislead or deceive and material which is defamatory; defamatory material does not fall outside the operation of s. 52(1) merely by reason of its being defamatory.
(cth) trade practices act s 6(3), s 52, s 80(2)
interim injunction in respect of publication by e-mail and on an internet website of allegedly false injurious information about the applicant's mode of carrying on its business.

citances.sentence: There has been some mention in the discussion of a recent widely publicised decision of Greenwood J in Schwabe Pharma (Aust) Pty Ltd v. AusPharm.Net.Au Pty Ltd [2006] FCA 868 , which may be another precedent available to Mr Bickford.
